comments.commentBody:
Intelligence officers and the intelligence community do not immediately act on information as it unravels, they want to protect their sources and verify. This can take some time. I'm happy to hear that they had the foresight to protect this data and that it can be used to everyone's benefit.

Also, it is unfortunate that HRC's emails received more attention than Russian, or FBI director Comey's interference, but that was they way it went down.

Why is this information classified in the first place? No security of the nAtion would be breached. No person's safety would be placed in  jeopardy. Making it public can only enhance our national security since the citizenry would be made aware of the dangers we are faced with. There was hesitancy when it came to the interminable and fruitless investigations of the clintons for over 30 years.

Those of you who are not old enough to remember Watergate, and those who are, Nixon said on many occasions that he was not a criminal and that he knew no criminals. Furthermore, Watergate had its unnamed sources, one of which was the #2 man in the FBI, and the Washington Post insisted that information provided by 'confidential sources' was confirmed two or three times, even if those confirmations requested that they not be named either. History repeats itself, even if the repeats don't match up perfectly. Like Nixon's administration, heads will eventually roll in the Trump administration, and, like the Nixon Presidency, Trump's might as well end in another Presidential resignation.

Honestly, the evidence was pretty blatant during the entire election. Trump himself said that the election was rigged...in his favor. He asked Russia to hack Clinton's emails on live television. That sure looked like treason to me the minute he did that. That episode should have created public outrage but the focus was so much on Clinton's stupid emails that it got lost in all the rest of the verbal diarrhea coming out of Trump's mouth. The entire election was a sham, and Trump is a fraud and traitor.

Trump and his administration have been choosing the narrative since the beginning.  Too many suspicions abound and I have much doubt on the veracity of Session's involvement with Russia which have been raised since Flynn resigned. The controversies and allegations in this administration is staggering and I fear will implode in their own makeshift pressure cooker.

It's hard tp see how this ends well. The NYT and Washington Post will inevitably be on Trump's enemies list as will the cable news channels and other media who report on it and dig in for more details. The so-called Deep State in the intelligence agencies, Justice, State and other agencies will fight to keep this information from going dark and the Trump administration will intensify its efforts to ferret out the members of those and other agencies who know damaging information and are willing to share it. And as the leakers are found, what then? Is firing them enough or will prosecution follow? And this is only the Russia story. Similar but less dramatic stories will unfold as the Trump cabinet starts destroying their own agencies, with leakers providing the only light that will shine on the destruction.

It is difficult not to attribute frightening motives to Trump and his inner circle as they seek to discredit the media and destroy even the concept that objective truth exists.

replies.commentBody: They would just move on to something new ...as I'm sure you were already aware of ...

comments.commentBody: It's so easy for Trump to put to rest all of these questions. Ask for an independent investigation and release his tax returns. That would clear this matter up and reveal Trump in all his innocence.

replies.commentBody:
Read the emails ... they knew how bad she was ... they still supported her ...

Keep the faith ...Trump will get rid of more deplorables ...

DRAIN THE SWAMP.

comments.commentBody:
Obama never even hinted about this information before the election. Would Trump show such restraint? Would he be held accountable if he did?

Working to preserve this evidence was the work of a truly patriotic administration.

It's incredible to see that nearly half of the country either doesn't believe or won't admit that Obama, his administration, and Democrats care more about the safety and well-being of our citizens, red, blue, and everything in between, than Trump and the GOP.

If Hillary and several members of her administration had 1/100th this much evidence against her of corruption, incompetence, and disregard for human rights and dignity as DT has had in the past 6 weeks, would Democrats allow them to stay in office?

I pray for an awakening and a reckoning in 2018 when a landslide vote washes all the deplorables out of the swamp.

replies.commentBody: Keep dreaming! You all are truly demented.
Looking forward to more wikileaks and the 650k emails on Weiner's laptop!

comments.commentBody:
The way the leaks are being relesed is pretty methodical:
1. First release weak stuff to enable Trump and his associates &political supporters to dig in and and laugh at accusations. They all feel confident.
2. Release a bit harder stuff and watch them dig in harder and increase the confidence. Their assumptions is that if they had something really hard it would be released by now. Congressional investigations should have started at this point.
3. Release harder stuff and watch some Trump support getting nervous, others keep digging in. This is the critical moment to differentiate few relatively acceptable (can't find real ones anymore in power) conservatives from apparatchiks, power hungry an money grabbing phonies. We are at this point now. It becomes scandalous for Congress not to initiate independen investigation.
4. Release hard data with transcripts, maybe tapes and witness testimonies.
Real carnage ensues. Soon to come.

Smart, very smart. It's a shell game. The more people that have it the less likely the revealing of it could be traced. I anticipate the evidence will ultimately be revealed without endangering any particular source. Very smart. I think the term is if one hangs, we all hang together. There's power in numbers.

replies.commentBody: It's not just the fear but the reality as well. They did poorly under the iron fist of communism but have largely fared even worse with their "freedom."
Not being funny at all but was this some kind of message to your friend? Scary to say the least.

comments.commentBody:
I had a coworker that was assigned to Russia for a few years and had a nice apartment in Moscow. Some of the stories he told when he came back were crazy. One stood out. It had to do with a dead body that appeared on the sidewalk in front of his place when he went to walk to work one morning. A well dressed middle aged man lying there that he thought had met with some terrible fate My friend stepped around him as did half the people walking down the block. The body layed there for over four days until when he came back one evening it was gone except for some blood stains. What really got to him was that all the people walking bye for those four days as my friend watched out the window, no one stopped or even looked at the body. All his efforts to inquire and sound an alarm were met with shrugs.

It's a different world over there. Years of oppression and fear have produced a police state of the highest order. None of these stories coming from the Trump campaign should surprise anyone.

As usual, follow the money.

replies.commentBody:
To fran soyer:
As mentioned before, Robert Mercer is the one to watch.
Google him;read a few entries.

comments.commentBody:
Be careful with this and future stories.

I'm sure the Bannon crew will be trying to pass off false information to the press via a third party with the specific intent of suing them out of existence for doing so.

replies.commentBody: Patience. This is chess. You must not try to check mate too soon.

comments.commentBody: Messieurs MR, AG and MS: what’s the point of writing that the Obama administration rushed to preserve Intelligence of Russian election hacking? I am tired of hearing the same story over and over and over. If your are not giving fresh new information that directly uncovers the names of any of Mr. Trump’s associates and explain what exactly the associate did makes no sense to continue writing and speculating about Russia’s intervention during the election.  This is not going to remove DT from his post. The F.B.I. and all the agencies that have such intelligence should rush and finish the investigation and disclose the names of all the person implicated so they can be fired and prosecuted. Already the entire world knows about this; it is not a secret. The only names revealed so far are Mr. Flynn and Mr. Sessions. Flynn lied to Spence and was fired; Sessions lied to all the members of Congress and should be fired too. And, if DT is also compromised, he should be impeached immediately. I really do not understand why the F.B.I. procrastinates in releasing intelligence for such an important and dangerous matter. This is quite serious and shouldn’t wait. The credibility of the US around the world needs to be restored by strongly showing that the US does not tolerate Russian actions

Each passing day brings new reasons to question ties between the Trump team and various Russians. Today it's Jeff Sessions having potentially lied under oath. Clearly, the nation needs a special prosecutor to find out the full story of Trump's connection to Russia, particularly his relationship to "fertilizer king" Dmitry Rybolovlev.

The full picture of all this criminality, lying and malfeasance is only just now coming into view, but it would be a fair bet to say there is enough intel on hand -- throughout the gov and press and in foreign intel agencies, as well -- whereby Trump and all those closely associated will have to step down en masse.  There won't even be an impeachment process; Trump and co. will plea bargain a sudden and relatively smooth exit for less jail time and/or smaller fines.  America will be rocked to the core, and the stock market will have some tough days.  But, alas, it's probably the only way forward.  The threat to the Republic in the coming months will be, arguably, immense and unprecedented.

replies.commentBody: The problem is not that he had the meetings  if they were innocent ,but that he failed to bring them up under oath in his nomination process. Big problem there in an Attorney General,a fireable offense IMO.

comments.commentBody:
So far a lot of leaking and gossip about talks with Russians and Trump associates.
Commentators and legal experts have all explained repeatedly that every new administration has talks with foreign powers. There is nothing wrong with any Trump associate speaking with Russians. There are big problems if the talks concerned collusion to attempt to interfere with an American democratic election. So far, no one, absolutely no one has leaked or reported that occurred.
It is very disheartened to read and listen to so many American citizens that seem to want this to be true or even hope it is true so that Trump will be forced to resign. I tell my younger relatives who often have very strong views about issues that just because you believe it to be true or want it to be true does not mean that it is true.
I hope that the actual facts are investigated and that the American people hear what really happened. I also hope that if no bad acts occurred, we will not be disappointed and will be actually relieved that no group of people seeking the Presidency would collude with Russia to undermine our democratic process.
If it turns out that collusion did occur, then Trump should resign if he knew about it and we should all be disappointed that as citizens we chose Trump as President and equally disappointed that Clinton was chosen to challenge Trump.
I did not vote for Trump, but I believe it will be a mournful day if collusion occurred and I would rather have Trump as President.

To be sure tomorrow morning Trump and his minions will be labeling this as President Obama's and fake media's attend to get him rather than what it is: a desperate attempt by the outgoing Administration to preserve and protect information so Trump could not burry and destroy it.

Note to self. Check Trump's reaction in the morning.

replies.commentBody: I agree!
It's because they are only in campaign mode, not yet in power. If this had been Obama the Republicans would be screaming from the mountain tops.

I'd say the crime was lying about contacts, and lying at crucial times.  Sessions didn't say that he'd spoken to Russians about the election.  But couldn't he have just said yes, I spoke with them but it was about (whatever blah blah blah) and not elections or anything else treasonous?  Why did these Republicans never give a straight answer?  Ingrained paranoia?  Oh, and I do believe Flynn should have said that yes he did meet with Russians about whatever.  But when asked, he lied because he thought he might get away with it.  So underhanded.

comments.commentBody:
Still don't get what all the fuss is about. What is wrong with Presidential campaigns making contact with the governments of most major countries? As for Russian interference, I'm glad they leaked real emails effectively unmasking Hillary, the DNC and Podesta. If Deep Throat had leaked them instead of the Russians, would it have made a difference?

Accusations of "hacking" and "interfering" are made, but I have yet to hear of a specific crime being alleged. The exaggerated vague condemnations of Russia seems like a brazen attempt to shift blame and evade responsibility for Hillary's loss. It doesn't wash. Did the Russians stop Hillary from campaigning in Wisconsin? Did the Russians make up the phony polls showing Hillary was a lock?

I didn't vote for Trump, but I'm sick of this and find myself feeling he is being unfairly maligned. The hysteria is way overblown. I'm even starting to sympathize with Putin.

Please continue focusing on the Russia story, Trump's taxes, his fight against the media and other whistleblowers, and the financial profits he and his family reap by taking advantage of the Presidency - until the entire truth comes out. It is irrelevant what speeches he gives and how he may try to prettify the ugly face of his administration. For as long as these dark clouds hover above his presidency, the foundation of democracy in America is threatened.

replies.commentBody: 1984 playbook

comments.commentBody: Trump war against Mexico is underway.  A vulnerable nation, should be easily subdued. Then the war against China, a great power that has been preparing for decades against this moment. Hence the not so strange alliance with Russia, the Chinese will face a Russo American alliance and knows this so perhaps they will bend more easily. Trump is behaving very much like a man who understands power not just money. What has Kissinger been telling him?

If it is discovered that candidate Trump and/or his team had knowledge of Russian collusion with their campaign in swaying the election: (1) would involvement with a major foreign adversary in fact have legally corrupted the campaign and (2) hence, invalidated the election process?

If so, (a) would the democrats have the right to bring this to the Federal/Supreme Court, (b) and potentially invalidate the election results, and (c) consequently invalidate all of the administrative actions including executive orders, cabinet and other executive appointments, etc.?

replies.commentBody: Right ... because that worked so well when Hillary was bleach bitting emails.
Benghazi. Thirteen GOP investigations. Millions of dollars spent.  Zero indictments.

You are right, if the Democrats had committed the acts the Trump campaign is accused of they would be in jail, and rightly so.

This should all come out eventually, however one wonders how deep Russian moles have infiltrated the US Intelligence Agencies and how committed they will be to uncovering the truth.

comments.commentBody:
If this were a winning Democratic President whose campaign was believed to have had improper contact with Russian officials to influence the election outcome, Republicans would have conducted multiple inquiries and hearings by now while having the assumed guilty Democratic President and their entire team wearing ankle bracelet monitors/alarms as impeachment/imprisonment procedures were being fashioned quicker than any of the multiple votes to repeal Obamacare over the past few years.

Trump can either put up any evidence like his taxes and insist on as many private investigative hearings as necessary to prove his innocence or shut up and continue to deny, deflect, blame and play the hapless victim here which presumes he is guilty of treason and must be imprisoned.

replies.commentBody: Yes -- and "eventually" is the very worrying word.

When will "the truth" about the Clintons come out?   When will we understand why Hillary used John Podesta's brother to "move" 20% of our uranium supply to Russia?   And, why did Tony Podesta give money to the Clinton Global Initiative?   IOW, why was the USA not compensated for the uranium, since it was OURS?    Why did Hillary get to "sell" our resources and why did SHE seem to get paid for doing so?

The Repubiicans can't handle the truth, and will do everything in their power to stymy any investigation seeking to obtain evidence, e.g Senators Burr (Intelligence Committee) and Mitch McConnell, trying to hamper the investigation at every turn. It's clear these spineless synchophants have sold their soul to Trump, the guy they denigrated during the campaign. May they all rot in the lowest circle of Dante's Inferno.

comments.commentBody:
I remain afraid about how Donald Trump and his cabinet might affect this country's sense of natural order, but in the back of my head I keep words of advice passed on from my wonderful mother: "The truth will always come out."

I don't know when, and I don't know how. It might be two weeks from now or two years from now. But a ship built as poorly as Donald Trump's will eventually sink. And when it does, it will hopefully bring with it the deficient members of the GOP who have hung on for dear, desperate life.

The truth will set the United States free. And the truth will eventually come out.

replies.commentBody: Trump and his associates are the traitors.

comments.commentBody: More fake news. A fabric woven with half truths, unnamed sources, and outright lies. President Obama is primarily responsible for this insurgency, utilizing all of his resources before leaving office and leaving moles in every agency to continue his dirty work. Once the prosecutions of the traitors begins, we will see how high it goes. Many of these moles are not strong people and will give up their handlers to avoid 10 years to life in prison.

replies.commentBody: Russia DID NOT alter our elections. Nobody liked Hillary from day one.

comments.commentBody:
This is a major scandal. Trump has installed Jeff Sessions as a fixer to make sure this will never be investigated. Nixon was routed from office for much less. Shame on Trump, and shame on is sycophantic, idiotic followers who don't see how dangerous this activity has been and will continue to be for
American security, and for the integrity of the American political process.

We not only have a liar for a president, we have a compromised puppet-president who is only decent when he is propped up in front of a teleprompter reading Steve Bannon's text. His address to the Congress was a travesty. He clearly had not even read the whole text before he recited it verbatim. And he is being praised for not going crazy again. What a low standard.

And again, what a scandal.
